thread.title: Manchester United to reward Jose Mourinho with new five-year contract | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United to reward Jose Mourinho with new five-year contract | Metro News

author: Louis Sealey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Manchester United to reward Jose Mourinho with new five-year contract | Metro News
text:
Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 11:15 am Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester United are preparing to offer Jose Mourinho with a new five-year contract at Old Trafford, reports say. 
Following an indifferent start to the season United are now flying under Mourinho and, after not losing in the Premier League since October, the club find themselves just two points outside of the top four. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
The Red Devils also look set for a productive run in the Europa League after sealing a commanding 3-0 win over St-Etienne in the last-32 stage. 
Old Trafford chiefs are understood to be hugely impressed by Mourinho’s debut season at the club and are ready to table an improved contract. 
The Sunday World say United want to tie Mourinho down until 2022, keen for the Portuguese to continue his rebuilding job at the club. Manchester United fixtures 
St-Etienne – Europa (A) – Wed 22 Feb Southampton – EFL (N) – Sun 26 Feb Bournemouth (H) – Sat 4 Mar Southampton (A) – Sun 12 Mar Middlesbrough (A) – Sun 19 Mar West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr 
Mourinho, who was appointed manager last May, has previously stated his desire to extend his stay at Man United. 
The Red Devils, sixth in the top-flight, take on Championship outfit Blackburn Rovers in the FA Cup on Sunday.
